com.yantra.api.ycm

Interface manageCategory

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCMApi, YIFApi

    public interface manageCategory

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document manageCategory(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The manageCategory API creates, modifies, or deletes existing categories.

    • Method Detail

      • manageCategory

        org.w3c.dom.Document manageCategory(YFSEnvironment env,
                                    org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                             throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                    java.rmi.RemoteException

        The manageCategory API creates, modifies, or deletes existing categories.

        The default behavior of the manageCategory API is to create a new category if the specified category does not exist, or modify the category if it does. This is the same as passing Action as Manage. Pass Create or Modify in the Action attribute to use a specific behavior. Additionally, Delete may be passed to delete a category.

        Categories describe an item set in a number of different, hierarchical, searchable groupings. Each category can contain items from multiple master catalogs.

        When a first level category is created by a sub-catalog organization, that same sub-catalog organization must be the authorized sub-catalog organization of the category domain. When a child category is created by a sub-catalog organization, that same sub-catalog organization must be the authorized sub-catalog organization or the owner of the parent category.

        The Categories may be re-arranged in an order within its hierarchy using SequenceNo. For better performance, SequenceNos, if passed in the input, must not be contiguous. They must be preferably in steps of 100. If an InsertBefore element is passed in the input, the SequenceNo is computed for that Category to be less than the SequenceNo of the InsertBefore element. An update of SequenceNo for all records appearing after this record in sequence is performed, if necessary. To avoid computed SequenceNos from running out of permitted maximum value of 99999, they must begin at the lower end of the possible values such as 10 or 100.

        Assigning Attributes

        Sub-catalog organizations will be able to assign catalog organization's attributes to its categories. When a sub-catalog organization assigns attributes to its categories, the attributes will only propagate down to the same sub-catalog organization's categories. When the catalog organization assigns attributes to one of its category and that category has a child category that is owned by a sub-catalog organization, then the attributes will not be propagated down to that child category.

        Attributes may be assigned to categories as well as classifications and are saved as ItemAttribute records. Once an attribute is assigned to a category/classification, it will be pushed down to the inheritable lower level categories/classifications during the configuration. The IsInherited flag will indicate whether the assignment is based on inheritance of the attribute that was assigned to the upper level categories/classifications.

        When an Item Attribute record for an ItemAttributeGroupType of ASSIGNMENT is deleted for a category, the value records will be removed for that category and all the child categories that have inherited the Item Attribute.

        An Item Attribute record for an ItemAttributeGroupType of FOR_FILTER can be assigned to a category only if the flag IsAllowedValueDefined on the Attribute record is set to Y. This means free-form text values cannot be used for filter purposes.

        Assigning Values For Attributes

        User will be able to choose the allowed values and assign them to the categories/classifications or the items within the assigned categories/ classifications. These assigned values will be stored as AdditionalAttribute records.

        The assigned values will be validated against the computed allowed values for the Attribute. The validation of the assigned value will be performed only if the flag IsAllowedValueDefined on the Attribute record is set to Y. Also, the Value attribute of the AdditionalAttribute record will be validated against AllowedValueLength attribute for a TEXT Attribute only if the IsAllowedValueDefined flag is not set to Y. An Attribute configured as a derived attribute may be assigned to a category, but its value may not be assigned to a category or item. Validation will also be performed to ensure that the assigned value is not for an attribute which is associated with an AttributeReference. For attributes which do not allow multiple values, the Operation="Manage" will intelligently try to remove the old value (if one exists) and associate new value if the property yfs.manageCategory.additionalAttr.tryIntelligentUpdateOfSingleValuedAttr is set. If the approach to update an attribute value fails or if not using this property, the previous value has to be deleted before setting a new Value.

        When attribute allowed values are assigned to a category/classification of catalog organization, they will be inherited by the catalog organization's lower level categories/ classifications and the items within the category/classifications and lower level categories/classifications. When attribute allowed values are assigned to a category/classification of sub-catalog organization, they will be inherited by the sub-catalog organization's lower level categories/ classifications and the items within the category/classifications and lower level categories/classifications. The IsInherited flag is used to indicate whether the AdditionalAttribute record is inherited from parent category.

        The Inherited value may be overridden by the child category. Such an overridden value will be then pushed down to its own child categories, and the items belonging to them. When a value is overridden by a child category, all other values for that attribute are now overridden by that category. An overridden value will have the flag IsInherited set to N.

        When a child category deletes all values for an attribute, it automatically inherits values from the parent for that attribute, if any.

        Mass Update Of Attributes And Values

        When an attribute is assigned to a parent category, all child categories of the same catalog/sub-catalog organization falling in the hierarchy of the parent inherit this attribute which is also persisted in DB. Similarly, when an attribute value is assigned to a parent category, all child categories of the same catalog/sub-catalog organization falling in the hierarchy of the parent inherit this attribute which is also persisted in DB. So also, all items belonging to any of the categories in the hierarchy inherit the values, which are again persisted in DB. However, if any child category has overridden a value inherited from parent category, this category will cease to inherit further values from the parent category for that attribute, as also all sub-child categories falling in the hierarchy of this child category.

        In order to improve performance of manageCategory API, the operation of persisting is done through a single SQL for each inherited attribute or value. It will be ensured that mass insert of value for an item happens only if such a value does not already exist for the item. When a value record is removed from a category, the corresponding records get deleted for all child categories and items that have inherited the value through mass delete operation. However, if an item has inherited the same value from different categories, it is made sure that the value record is not deleted as long as it is inheriting the value from at least one category.

        Note: Due to a limitation, when this API is invoked to create a Category having CategoryLocale data associated it results in a "Data Security Violation" error. Instead use a multiApi or two separate API calls to insert the Category and corresponding CategoryLocale data separately.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised:
        These events are raised under the CATEGORY_DEFINITION transaction.

        AFTER_CREATE_CATEGORY:

          This event is raised after successful creation of the Category.
          Keydata: Not published.
          Data published: Create Category Event XML
          Template Support: No

        AFTER_MODIFY_CATEGORY:

          This event is raised after successful modification of the Category.
          Keydata: Not published.
          Data published: Modify Category Event XML
          Template Support: No

        AFTER_DELETE_CATEGORY:

          This event is raised after successful deletion of the Category.
          Keydata: Not published.
          Data published: Delete Category Event XML
          Template Support: No

        ON_ATTRIBUTE_CHANGE:

          This event is raised on successful execution of mass insert or delete of ItemAttributes and AdditionalAttributes for valid child categories. This event will contain the changes to the assigned attributes and assigned attribute values for the child categories.
          Keydata: Not published.
          Data published: On Attribute Change Event XML
          Template Support: Yes

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions:

          If the category ID of a particular category is modified, the category path of all categories below it are also automatically updated.

          Deleting a category also deletes all child categories.

          When creating a category, the category path can be passed to identify where to create the new category. If any category in the path does not exist, it is automatically created.

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        Empty XML Document Object (for future use only).

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
